sen.j: 織田 一磨（おだ かずま、1882年11月11日 - 1956年3月18日）は明治期から昭和期の芸術家、版画家。
sen.e: Kazuma ODA (November 11, 1882 - March 18, 1956) was an artist and a printmaker, who lived during the Meiji period to the Showa period.
Kazuma ODA (November 11, 1882 - March 18, 1956) was an artist and a printmaker, who lived during the Meiji period to the Showa period.
Kazuma ODA (November 11, 1882 - March 18, 1956) was an artist and a printmaker, who lived during the Meiji period to the Showa period.
He was the fourth son of Nobunori ODA.
He was the fourth son of Nobunori ODA.
He was the fourth son of Nobunori ODA.

sen.j: 明治15年（1882）11月11日東京にて誕生。
sen.e: He was born in Tokyo on November 11, 1882.
He was born in Tokyo on November 11, 1882.
He was born in Tokyo on November 11, 1882.

sen.j: 洋画を川村清雄、石版画を金子政次郎に学ぶ。
sen.e: He learned Western-style paintings from Kiyoo KAWAMURA and lithographs from Masajiro KANEKO.
He learned Western-style paintings from Kiyoo KAWAMURA and lithographs from Masajiro KANEKO.
He learned Western-style paintings from Kiyoo KAWAMURA and lithographs from Masajiro KANEKO.

sen.j: 「自画石版の織田一磨」として知られる。
sen.e: He is known as 'Kazuma ODA of self-portrait lithograph.'
sen.cmt: 自画石版→定訳不明：self-portrait lithograph としました。「自画石版の織田一磨」→定訳不明：'Kazuma ODA of self-portrait lithograph' としました。
sen.e: He is known as 'Kazuma ODA of self-portrait lithograph.'
He is known as 'Kazuma ODA of self-portrait lithograph.'

sen.j: 主な作品は東京国立近代美術館などに収められている。
sen.e: His masterpieces are collected at the National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo, and others.
His masterpieces are collected at the National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo, and others.
His masterpieces are collected at the National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo, and others.

sen.j: 明治27年（1894）頃、父信徳らと大阪に転居する。
sen.e: Around 1894, he moved to Osaka with his father Nobunori.
Around 1894, he moved to Osaka with his father Nobunori.
Around 1894, he moved to Osaka with his father Nobunori.

sen.j: その後、広島石版印刷所や大阪市役所図案調製所に勤務する。
sen.e: Afterwards, he worked at Hiroshima Sekihan Insatsu-jo (Hiroshima lithoprinting house) and Zuanchosei-jo (design coordination center) of Osaka City Office.
sen.cmt: 広島石版印刷所→定訳不明：Hiroshima Sekihan Insatsu-jo (Hiroshima lithoprinting house) としました。図案調製所→定訳不明：Zuanchosei-jo (design coordination center) としました。
sen.e: Afterwards, he worked at Hiroshima Sekihan Insatsu-jo (Hiroshima lithoprinting house) and Zuanchosei-jo (design coordination center) of Osaka City Office.
Afterwards, he worked at Hiroshima Sekihan Insatsu-jo (Hiroshima lithoprinting house) and Zuanchosei-jo (design coordination center) of Osaka City Office.

sen.j: 明治36年東京に戻るものの、明治44年大阪帝国新聞社入社のために再び大阪に転居する。
sen.e: Although he returned to Tokyo in 1903 (表記の変更), he again moved to Osaka 1911(表記の変更) to join a newspaper company, Osaka Teikoku Shinbun-sha.
sen.cmt: 大阪帝国新聞社→定訳不明：a newspaper company, Osaka Teikoku Shinbun-sha としました。
sen.e: Although he returned to Tokyo in 1903 (表記の変更), he again moved to Osaka 1911(表記の変更) to join a newspaper company, Osaka Teikoku Shinbun-sha.
Although he returned to Tokyo in 1903 (表記の変更), he again moved to Osaka 1911(表記の変更) to join a newspaper company, Osaka Teikoku Shinbun-sha.

sen.j: 同社退社後、東京に戻る。
sen.e: After retiring the post, he returned to Tokyo.
After retiring the post, he returned to Tokyo.
After retiring the post, he returned to Tokyo.

sen.j: 昭和6年（1931）吉祥寺に住まいを構える。
sen.e: In 1931, he settled in Kichijoji, Tokyo.
In 1931, he settled in Kichijoji, Tokyo.
In 1931, he settled in Kichijoji, Tokyo.

sen.j: 昭和20年富山県福野町に疎開し、昭和24年まで同県で暮らす。
sen.e: In 1945, he fled to Fukuno-machi, Toyama Prefecture for safety and lived there until 1949.
In 1945, he fled to Fukuno-machi, Toyama Prefecture for safety and lived there until 1949.
In 1945, he fled to Fukuno-machi, Toyama Prefecture for safety and lived there until 1949.

sen.j: 明治40年の第一回文展、明治42年の第二回文展などに作品を出品する。
sen.e: He presented his work at the first Bunten exhibition (the annual art exhibition sponsored by the Ministry of Education) in 1907 (表記の変更), and at the second Bunten exhibition in 1909 (表記の変更), among others.

He presented his work at the first Bunten exhibition (the annual art exhibition sponsored by the Ministry of Education) in 1907 (表記の変更), and at the second Bunten exhibition in 1909 (表記の変更), among others.

He presented his work at the first Bunten exhibition (the annual art exhibition sponsored by the Ministry of Education) in 1907 (表記の変更), and at the second Bunten exhibition in 1909 (表記の変更), among others.

sen.j: 大正7年に連作「東京風景」を完成させる。
sen.e: In 1918 (表記の変更), he accomplished a series of pictures, 'Tokyo fukei' (Sceneries of Tokyo).
sen.cmt: 「東京風景」→定訳不明：'Tokyo fukei' (Sceneries of Tokyo) としました。
sen.e: In 1918 (表記の変更), he accomplished a series of pictures, 'Tokyo fukei' (Sceneries of Tokyo).
In 1918 (表記の変更), he accomplished a series of pictures, 'Tokyo fukei' (Sceneries of Tokyo).

sen.j: また、大正7年（1918年）に日本創作版画協会、昭和5年に洋風版画協会を設立する。
sen.e: He also founded Nihon Sosaku-hanga Kyokai (Japan creative print art association) in 1918, and Yofu-hanga Kyokai (Western-style print art association) in 1930 (表記の変更).
sen.cmt: 日本創作版画協会→定訳不明：Japan Sosaku-hanga (creative print art) Association としました。洋風版画協会→定訳不明：Yofu-hanga Kyokai (Western-style print art association) としました。
sen.e: He also founded Nihon Sosaku-hanga Kyokai (Japan creative print art association) in 1918, and Yofu-hanga Kyokai (Western-style print art association) in 1930 (表記の変更).
He also founded Nihon Sosaku-hanga Kyokai (Japan creative print art association) in 1918, and Yofu-hanga Kyokai (Western-style print art association) in 1930 (表記の変更).
He died on March 18, 1956.
He died on March 18, 1956.
He died on March 18, 1956.
